stanaDeVale.title: Stâna de Vale
stanaDeVale.description1: In the 1st week-end of July, Stâna de Vale will host the 2nd leg of the EMA Off Road Circuit 2025. Stâna de Vale is nowadays a well known mountain resort –elevation 1000m- situated in the north-west of Romania, Bihor County. Initially the fame of the resort originated from the mineral water springs in the area, particularly recommended for a range of cures.
stanaDeVale.description2: In recent years the area has been developed to attract tourists with its relaxing landscapes and as a sky resort.
stanaDeVale.hostDescription: ACS Atletic Beiuş has got a name in the Romanian community of off road runners for having yearly organized the highly successful "Beiuş Running Day", a 10k/21k trail run in the hills neighbouring the town. The quality of the organization and the geography of the region prompted the Masters Commission within the FRA to challenge the host to organize the 2024 edition of the National Championships of Mountain Running higher up in nearby Stâna de Vale. The one day meeting, including a classical 11k up&down D+470m and a 33k long trail D+1300m, was highly appreciated by the competitors who insisted for a repeat of the event in 2025. The generous contribution of the local sponsors to the after race party must have impacted greatly on the attendants request for an encore.

rules.title: Rules & Regulations
rules.subtitle: Familiarize yourself with the competition rules to ensure a safe and fair race for everyone.
rules.importantDescription: All participants must adhere to these rules for their safety and the integrity of the competition. Non-compliance may result in penalties or disqualification.
rules.introduction: The Stana de Vale Trail Race is organized in accordance with international trail running standards and regulations. The following rules apply to all participants in both the 11km and 33km races.
rules.contactQuestion: Have questions about the rules? Contact us at: contact@stanatrailrace.ro or +40744534802

rules.1: All runners must follow the marked course at all times. Deviating from the marked trail or taking shortcuts is strictly prohibited and will result in disqualification.
rules.2: Bib numbers must remain visible at all times during the race.
rules.3: Participants must check in at all control points along the course.
rules.4: Runners must respect the environment. Littering is strictly prohibited and will result in disqualification.
rules.5: In case of withdrawal, participants must inform race officials at the nearest checkpoint.

rules.1: Race bib visible at all times

rules.2: 33km race: 8-hour time limit with cut-offs at 15km (3 hours) and 25km (6 hours).

rules.1: 11km race: One aid station at km 5.
rules.2: 33km race: Five aid stations located at km 5.4, 10.4, 15.5, 20.9, and 26.6.
rules.3: All aid stations provide water, isotonic drinks, and light snacks.
rules.4: Medical assistance is available at each aid station.

rules.2: Littering on the course: immediate disqualification.
rules.3: Using trekking poles in prohibited areas: 30-minute time penalty.
rules.4: Failure to assist a runner in distress: disqualification.
rules.5: Receiving unauthorized assistance outside of aid stations: disqualification.

rules.1: Race organizers may modify the course or cancel the event in case of severe weather conditions.
rules.2: Medical teams have the authority to withdraw participants deemed unfit to continue.
rules.3: Participants must assist any runner in distress and report to the next aid station.
rules.4: In case of emergency, call the race emergency number provided on your bib.

rules.1: Stay on marked trails to minimize environmental impact.
rules.2: Carry all waste to the next aid station or finish line.
rules.3: Respect wildlife and local regulations in protected areas.

rules.1: Minimum age for 11km race: 16 years old (with parental consent for minors).
rules.2: Minimum age for 33km race: 18 years old.
rules.3: All participants must sign a liability waiver before the race.
rules.4: Race bibs are personal and non-transferable.

registration.question: How do I register for the competition?
registration.answer: Registration is available online through our website. Simply go to the Registration section, choose your race, fill out the form, and complete the payment. You'll receive a confirmation email with all the details.

equipment.question: What should I bring on race day?
equipment.answer: Bring your ID, confirmation email, and all the required equipment for your race. Check the Rules section for the specific equipment required for your race distance. Don't forget to dress appropriately for the weather conditions.

stations.question: Are there aid stations on the course?
stations.answer: Yes, there are aid stations along all race routes. The 10km race has 2 aid stations, the 21km race has 4 aid stations, and the 50km race has 8 aid stations. Each aid station provides water, sports drinks, and various snacks.

change.question: Can I change my race after registering?
change.answer: Race changes are possible up to 30 days before the event, subject to availability. To change your race, please contact our support team via email. Note that changing to a more expensive race requires an additional payment, while changing to a less expensive race does not offer a refund of the difference.

howToGet.title: How to Get to Stana de Vale
howToGet.subtitle: Practical travel information to help you reach the race destination.
howToGet.introduction: Stana de Vale is a picturesque mountain resort located in the Apuseni Mountains of Romania, offering breathtaking natural landscapes and the perfect setting for our trail running competition.
howToGet.weatherNote: Mountain roads can be affected by weather conditions, especially during winter and early spring. Always check road conditions before traveling.
howToGet.locationDescription: Stana de Vale is situated at an altitude of approximately 1,100 meters in Bihor County, Romania. It's known for its pristine forests, mountain springs, and beautiful hiking trails.

byAir.title: By Air
byAir.description: The closest airports to Stana de Vale are in Oradea and Cluj-Napoca. From there, you can continue your journey by car, train, or bus.

oradea.title: Oradea International Airport (OMR)
oradea.description: The closest airport to Stana de Vale:
oradea.distance: Approximately 70 km from Stana de Vale
oradea.transport: Taxis and car rentals available at the airport

cluj.title: Cluj-Napoca International Airport (CLJ)
cluj.description: A major international airport with more connections:
cluj.distance: Approximately 150 km from Stana de Vale
cluj.transport: Taxis, car rentals, and shuttle services available

byCar.title: By Car
byCar.description: Traveling by car provides flexibility to reach Stana de Vale. The mountain resort is accessible via several routes, though some roads can be challenging depending on the season.

fromOradea.title: From Oradea
fromOradea.description: There are two main routes from Oradea:
fromOradea.route1: Route 1: Oradea → Beiuș → Budureasa → Stana de Vale (approximately 80 km, 1h 45m)
fromOradea.route2: Route 2: Oradea → Aleșd → Borod → Bratca → Beiuș → Budureasa → Stana de Vale (longer but may offer better road conditions)

fromCluj.title: From Cluj-Napoca
fromCluj.route: Cluj-Napoca → Huedin → Borod → Beiuș → Budureasa → Stana de Vale (approximately an 3-hour drive)

parking.title: Parking Information
parking.description: There is a large parking area at the resort center where you can leave your vehicle during the competition. Additional parking will be available near the race start/finish area.

byBus.title: By Bus
byBus.description: Public bus transport can get you to towns near Stana de Vale, from where you'll need to arrange the final part of your journey.

services.title: Bus Services
services.service1: Oradea to Beiuș: Regular bus services throughout the day
services.service2: Cluj-Napoca to Beiuș: Limited services, check schedules in advance

schedules.title: Bus Schedules
schedules.description: Bus schedules can vary seasonally. We recommend checking the latest timetables at autogari.ro or directly with the local bus companies.

localTransport.title: Local Transportation
localTransport.description: For the final leg of your journey to Stana de Vale, you may need to use local transportation options.

taxis.title: Taxis
taxis.description: Taxis are available in Beiuș and can take you to Stana de Vale. Expect to pay approximately 100-150 RON for this journey.

shuttles.title: Race Day Shuttles
shuttles.description: Transportation organized by the organizers from Beiuș to Stana de Vale and return by bus.

fromDestination.title: Return from Stana de Vale to Beiuș:

accommodation.title: Accommodation Options
accommodation.description: There are several accommodation options in and around Stana de Vale to suit different preferences and budgets.

option1.title: Mountain Resort Hotel
option1.description: The main hotel in Stana de Vale offers comfortable rooms with mountain views, restaurant, and spa facilities.

option2.title: Nearby Guesthouses
option2.description: Several family-run guesthouses in the vicinity offer authentic local hospitality and homemade food.

option3.title: Camping
option3.description: For the adventurous, there are designated camping areas near the resort. Bring your own equipment or rent on-site.

overview.title: Overview
overview.content: European Masters Athletics (EMA) is proud to announce the inaugural experimental edition of the EMA Off-Road Running Circuit, a circuit dedicated to Master athletes featuring mountain, vertical, and off-road running events.
objectivesList: To provide optimal conditions for athletes to achieve outstanding performances.
To increase competition opportunities in a stimulating and diverse environment.
To foster greater interaction and cultural exchange among athletes.
To offer a broad range of participation options throughout the season.
To promote the diversity of the participating athletes.
overview.focus: The organizational focus will be on delivering well-structured, efficient events that create the best conditions for participants to excel and enjoy the experience.

participation.title: Participation
participation.content: Participation in the EMA Off-Road Running League is open to all athletes who meet the Masters Off-Road running criteria, specifically those aged 35-79, and who hold a valid license from their respective Federation, in accordance with WMA rules.
participation.note1: Please note, the EMA Off-Road Running League is not a championship event, and athletes will not officially represent their countries in these events.
participation.note2: The League is also open to non-European athletes, who will compete for individual event prizes as well as final awards.

liability.title: Liability and Insurance
liability.content: Participants assume full responsibility for their involvement in any event. The Organizer is not liable for any damages or injury sustained by the Participant, except in cases where the damage is the direct result of the Organizer's intentional actions.
liability.insurance: If the Organizer's insurance policy covers the damages, the Organizer's liability will be limited to the amount covered by the insurer. Participants are advised to obtain their own insurance to cover potential risks, such as accidents, illness, or death, that may arise during the event.
liability.health: By registering, participants confirm that they are in good physical and mental health, and have undergone appropriate training to compete in the event. It is recommended that participants undergo a medical examination to ensure fitness for participation.

rankings.title: Rankings
rankings.content: The EMA Off-Road Running Circuit will feature both individual event rankings and a final overall ranking for the Circuit.
rankings.local: Each Local Organizing Committee (LOC) may offer one or more events (such as uphill, vertical, mountain run, trail, etc.), with the winners and age category champions awarded prizes according to their local regulations. Each event will have a dedicated section on the EMA website.
rankings.eligibility: Final Ranking Eligibility: To qualify for the EMA final rankings, athletes must participate in at least two events across different locations.
rankings.points: Point Allocation: The winner of each event (overall and in each age category) will receive 1 point, with subsequent positions awarded points as follows (2 points for second place, 3 points for third, etc.). EMA will consider the best two performances from each athlete when calculating the final standings.
rankings.specialPrize: A special prize will be awarded to all athletes who participate in at least three stages of the Circuit, regardless of their overall results.
rankings.ceremony: The official award ceremony will be held during the 2026 EMA Off-Road Running Championship.

structure.title: Ranking Structure
structure.item1: Features individual event rankings and a final overall Circuit ranking.
structure.item2: Local Organizing Committees (LOCs) may offer various events (e.g., uphill, vertical, mountain run, trail) with prizes awarded per local regulations.
structure.item3: LOCs may register and award athletes under 35 or over 80 at their discretion, but only Masters athletes aged 35-79 are eligible for the EMA Circuit's final rankings.

finalEligibility.title: Final Ranking Eligibility
finalEligibility.content: Athletes must participate in at least two events across different locations to qualify for the final rankings.

pointAllocation.title: Point Allocation
pointAllocation.item1: Event winner (overall and age category) receives 1 point
pointAllocation.item3: Third place receives 3 points, and so on
pointAllocation.item4: Final standings are based on an athlete's best two performances
pointAllocation.note: Note: Lower point total is better, as this is a golf-style scoring system where 1st place = 1 point.

categories.title: Ranking Categories
categories.item1: First three male and female athletes ranked as Overall Winners
categories.item2: Age Category Winners for both men and women (35-75)

tieBreakers.title: Tie-Breakers
tieBreakers.item1: In case of a tie, the athlete with the higher finishing position in events takes precedence
tieBreakers.item2: If still tied, the number of races participated in serves as the tie-breaker

specialPrize.title: Special Prize
specialPrize.content: A special prize is awarded to athletes participating in at least three stages, regardless of results.

awardCeremony.title: Award Ceremony
awardCeremony.item1: Held during the 2026 EMA Off-Road Running Championship
awardCeremony.item2: If an athlete cannot attend, arrangements will be made for prize delivery

calendar.title: Calendar
calendar.content: The events in the 2025 EMA Off-Road Running Circuit will take place according to the following schedule:
calendar.finalNote: For the most up-to-date information, please visit the official EMA website.
calendar.updateNote: Please note: This calendar has been updated as per the official 2025 EMA Off-Road Running Circuit regulations. Check back regularly for any additional event announcements or changes.

cnMasters.title: CN Masters - National Mountain Running Championship
cnMasters.subtitle: National Mountain Running Championship for Masters - 2025 Edition
cnMasters.introText: The Romanian National Mountain Running Championship for Masters is one of the most prestigious mountain running competitions in Romania, organized with the support of the Romanian Athletics Federation (FRA). This event celebrates the exceptional achievements of Masters athletes aged 35 and above, showcasing their endurance, skill, and commitment to trail running.

race1.title: 33km Long Trail Race
race1.description: The primary championship race is the 33km Long Trail event, offering a challenging course through the breathtaking Carpathian Mountains with 1700m of elevation gain.

race2.title: 11km Classic UP/DOWN Race
race2.description: This shorter championship race offers a more accessible but equally challenging experience with 500m of elevation gain, perfect for those new to mountain running competitions.

cnMasters.categoriesNote: Age is determined based on the athlete's age on the day of the competition. All participants in the Masters categories must be members of clubs affiliated with the Romanian Athletics Federation or hold individual FRA licenses.

rules.1: Participants must be 35 years or older on the day of the competition.
rules.2: All participants must be Romanian citizens or legal residents.
rules.3: FRA membership or individual license is required for official ranking.
rules.4: Age category awards will be presented to the top three finishers in each category.
rules.5: The overall Masters Champions (male and female) will be crowned from across all age categories.

cnMasters.federationDescription: The Romanian Athletics Federation (Federația Română de Atletism) is the governing body for athletics in Romania, overseeing all official athletics competitions including mountain running events.

accommodation.title: Accommodation
accommodation.subtitle: Find the perfect place to stay during the competition
accommodation.introText: Stâna de Vale offers several accommodation options for participants and visitors. We recommend booking early as availability can be limited during the competition weekend. Below you'll find a selection of accommodations in the area, ranging from hotels to mountain lodges.
accommodation.noteText: Due to the popularity of the event and limited accommodation in Stâna de Vale, we strongly recommend booking your stay as early as possible, especially if you are coming with a group.
accommodation.alternativesText: If you prefer alternative accommodation options or if lodging in Stâna de Vale is fully booked, consider these alternatives:

camping.title: Camping
camping.description: For those who enjoy the outdoors, there is a designated camping area near the race start/finish. Bring your own tent and camping gear.
camping.priceDetails: €10 per tent per night, includes access to toilets and showers.

beius.title: Staying in Beiuș
beius.description: Beiuș is the nearest town with additional accommodation options, including several hotels and guesthouses.
beius.distanceDetails: Approximately 28 km from Stâna de Vale (35-40 minutes by car). Shuttle buses will be available on race day.

accommodation.needHelpText: If you need help finding suitable accommodation or have special requirements, don't hesitate to contact our team. We can provide recommendations based on your preferences and group size.

hotel1.description: The central hotel in Stâna de Vale, offering comfortable rooms, a restaurant serving traditional Romanian cuisine, and easy access to the race start/finish area.

hotel2.description: A cozy mountain lodge with traditional decor, offering basic but comfortable rooms in a beautiful natural setting just a short walk from the race center.

hotel3.description: A rustic cabin experience with stunning views of the mountains. Basic accommodations with a true mountain feel and authentic atmosphere.

hotel4.description: A family-run guesthouse offering comfortable rooms and homemade meals. Known for its warm hospitality and relaxing environment.

hotel5.description: A modern hotel in Beiuș with all amenities, including a restaurant, bar, and conference facilities. A good option for those who prefer staying in town.
